desc: TNFAIP3 encodes TNF alpha induced protein 3 that is induced by Tumor necrosis factor (TNF) alpha and regulates the NF-κB pathway (PMID: 11009421). TNFAIP3 has ubiquitin ligase and de-ubiquitination activities that suppress the NF-κB pathway (PMID: 15258597). Its activity is important in regulating B-cell survival and apoptosis, inflammatory response, and dentric cell function in regulating T-cells (PMID: 20705491, 18311150, 25043000). Polymorphisms in TNFAIP3 are associated with many autoimmune diseases such as systemic lupus erythematosus, Sjögren's syndrome, multiple sclerosis, and rheumatoid arthritis (PMID:19165919, 25684197, 24097067,17982455). Germline loss of function mutations are associated with autoimmune disease (PMID: 26642243). Mutations are found in B-cell lymphomas, T-cell large granular lymphocytic (LGL) leukemia, and peripheral T-cell lymphomas (PMID: 19412163, 21115979, 21625233, 26199174). TNFAIP3 mutation has been associated with transformation of lymphomas to more aggressive disease and varying prognosis depending on subtype (PMID: 24362818, 23327292, 21266526).
articles/0/title: Recurrent alterations of TNFAIP3 (A20) in T-cell large granular lymphocytic leukemia.
articles/1/title: Integrated genomic analysis identifies recurrent mutations and evolution patterns driving the initiation and progression of follicular lymphoma.
articles/2/title: A20 is an antigen presentation attenuator, and its inhibition overcomes regulatory T cell-mediated suppression.
articles/3/title: Loss-of-function mutations in TNFAIP3 leading to A20 haploinsufficiency cause an early-onset autoinflammatory disease.
articles/4/title: Clinicopathologic implication of A20/TNFAIP3 deletion in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma: an analysis according to immunohistochemical subgroups and rituximab treatment.
articles/5/title: Frequent inactivation of A20 in B-cell lymphomas.
articles/6/title: Negative regulation of the NLRP3 inflammasome by A20 protects against arthritis.
articles/7/title: Failure to regulate TNF-induced NF-kappaB and cell death responses in A20-deficient mice.
articles/9/title: The ubiquitin modifying enzyme A20 restricts B cell survival and prevents autoimmunity.
articles/10/title: Variants at multiple loci implicated in both innate and adaptive immune responses are associated with Sjögren's syndrome.
articles/11/title: Multiple polymorphisms in the TNFAIP3 region are independently associated with systemic lupus erythematosus.
articles/12/title: Tumor suppressor TNFAIP3 (A20) is frequently deleted in Sézary syndrome.
articles/13/journal: Clinical cancer research : an official journal of the American Association for Cancer Research
articles/14/title: De-ubiquitination and ubiquitin ligase domains of A20 downregulate NF-kappaB signalling.
articles/15/title: Association of TNFAIP3 and TNFRSF1A variation with multiple sclerosis in a German case-control cohort.
articles/16/title: Genome-wide DNA profiling of marginal zone lymphomas identifies subtype-specific lesions with an impact on the clinical outcome.

desc: TNFAIP3 encodes an enzyme involved in regulation of the NF-κB pathway. Mutations of TNFAIP3 are found in lymphomas and leukemias.
